info.document:
PLEASE MONITOR THE WNE INNOVATIONS FOLDER ON A DAILY BASIS AS STORIES ARE ADDED REGULARLY
NOW ON INNOVATIONS:
====================
5246-FINLAND-FOOD/AIR. A batch of single-cell protein - which can be further developed for use as food and animal feed - has been produced by Finnish researchers using electricity and carbon dioxide.  (Online version 5247)
5179-JORDAN-ENVIRONMENT/SAHARA. Jordan's King Abdullah and Norway's Crown Prince Haakon inaugurate the Sahara Forest Project which aims to provide the country with greenhouse vegetation and green energy. 
4266-SCIENCE-GENE/FRIENDLY-DOGS. U.S. researchers have identified a genetic difference between dogs and wolves that could explain why dogs are so friendly. (Online version 4267)
4186-AUSTRALIA-COMPUTING/QUANTUM. Researchers in Australia have found a new way to build quantum computers which they say would make them dramatically easier and cheaper to produce at scale. 
4173-BRITAIN-DEFENCE/UGV. Autonomous armed robots designed for the battlefield are among the exhibits at London's biennial arms fair. (Online version 4174)
4001-TECH-USA/3D SELF-FOLD. Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have created a printable structure that will fold itself up the moment it is peeled off the printer.
3017-SCIENCE-BRITAIN/SCAN MASK. Scientists develop a 3D-printed prototype wearable brain scanner they say is four times as sensitive as current magnetoencephalography systems. (3018)
2171-TECH-FLUORESCENT JACKET. Twin brothers Steve and Nick Tidball have created a solar-powered glow-in-the-dark, waterproof jacket that they hope will allow late-night runners and cyclists to safely exercise for up to twelve hours in the pitch black. (Online version 2172)
1147-USA-PASSIVE POLYGRAPH. Seattle-based SilverLogic Labs have developed what they call a 'passive polygraph', basically a hi-tech version of the lie detector test. (Online version 1148)
1143-POLAND-MARSROVER/. The Turtle Rover puts space-grade technology into the hands of consumers. (Online version 1144) 
Jim Drury - Innovations
+44 0207 542 7969
